comments:
Description:
Exception will throw when setting the Number of Series Definitions in Data--
>YAxis.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Insert a chart
2. Click Define Chart button
3. Select Data ->Y Axis in Chart Dialog,then input Number of Series Definitions 
as "-1",press enter.
4. Click No in Validation Results dialog
5. Use up arrow button in Number of Series Definitions edit box to change the 
value

Expected result:
No error.

Actual result:
When the value up to 2 or 3, exception is thrown as below:
org.eclipse.emf.common.util.BasicEList$BasicIndexOutOfBoundsException: index=0, 
size=0
	at org.eclipse.emf.common.util.BasicEList.get(BasicEList.java:511)
	at

(OrthogonalAxisDataSheetImpl.java:836)

(OrthogonalAxisDataSheetImpl.java:1039)

t(IntegerSpinControl.java:251)
	at 
org.eclipse.birt.chart.ui.swt.composites.IntegerSpinControl.widgetSelected
(IntegerSpinControl.java:240)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TypedListener.handleEvent
(TypedListener.java:90)

to be fixed in new builder
Depend on #110667. Resolved with new UI
Fixed in Chart UI V2.0. Series number is not by input any more.

No options to input Number of Series Definitions now.
Close this scr.
